cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi (120 km) south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly turning northwest tonight, then northward on Saturday–Sunday, moving inland across south-central Louisiana and up the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near/just west of Morgan City – Intracoastal City area

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron; Tropical Storm Watch: east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the Mississippi/Alabama border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle; Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, Lake Pontchartrain & Maurepas including metro New Orleans, Intracoastal City to Cameron
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline, Mississippi coastline to Biloxi, and adjacent north-central Gulf waters
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (35–50 kt) likely at Baton Rouge Saturday with gusts possibly near hurricane force as the center passes just west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the port’s inland location, though elevated water levels could be felt upriver.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–20 inches of rain with locally higher totals leading to significant river and flash flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential tornadoes in outer rainbands; prolonged river flooding on the Mississippi and local tributaries affecting terminal access.
